GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1972 by Government decree. A State Institution employing new teaching and learning methods based on an 'integrated' approach to higher education and placing emphasis on group work
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (studentereksamen), or appropriate educational level reached through formal or non-formal education

Divisions.College: Doctoral School of Communication and Arts
Doctoral School of People and Technology
Doctoral School of Science and Environment
Doctoral School of Social Sciences and Business

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1479. Acquired present status 2007 following the merger between the former Den Kgl. Veterinær- og Landbohøjskole (The Royal Veterinary and Agricultural University) and the Danmarks Farmaceutiske Universitet (The Danish University of Pharmaceutical Sciences). Financed by the State
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (studentereksamen), or foreign equivalent, and entrance examination in Danish language
Bachelor’s degree for admission into Master's programmes
Foreign exchange and guest students should be enrolled at a University in their home country or elsewhere abroad during their proposed stay at the University of Copenhagen

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1974. A State Institution incorporating previously established Centres of Education in Aalborg and employing new teaching and learning methods based on an 'integrated' approach to higher education, with emphasis on project work in groups. Financed by the State. The University has Departments in Esbjerg and Copenhagen
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (studentereksamen) or Højere-Forberedelseseksamen (HF), Højere, Handelseksamen, (HHX) or Højere Teknisk eksamen (HTX), or recognized equivalent

Divisions.Details: Copenhagen Institute of Technology;  Esberg Institute of Technology

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1965
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Studentereksamen) or recognized equivalent

Address.college_name: Aarhus School of Marine and Technical Engineering

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Aarhus Mechanical School, 1896. Acquired present title and status 1968

Founded 1928 by municipal authorities, recognized by Parliament 1931, and awarded Government grant. Achieved full University status 1934. Became State Institution 1970 under the supervision of the Ministry of Education

Divisions.Details: Previously independant school - merged with the university in 2012.

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 	2009

Address.university_name: Copenhagen Business School - Handelshøjskolen i København (CBS)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1917 as a private Institution, integrated into the national system, thus becoming self-governing 1965. Acquired present status 2003
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school leaving certificate (studentereksamen) or Højere Forberedelseseksamen, Højere Handelseksamen, Højere Teknisk eksamen or recognized equivalent

Divisions.College: French, German, Italian, Russian and Spanish
International Languages Studies and Computational Linguistics

Divisions.Details: International Law related to Business with focus on Law as a Management Tool, Frederiksberg

Address.college_name: Copenhagen School of Marine Engineering and Technology Management

GeneralInformation.History: Created 1906

Founded 1929 as a private institution, Det Fynske Musikkonservatorium became a government institution under the supervision of the Ministry of Cultural Affairs 1972. Reorganised and merged with the Academic of Music and Music Communication in Esberg, and the Acting school in Odense, 2010, to become The Academy of Music and Dramatic Arts, Southern Denmark (Syddansk Musikkonservatorium og Skuespillerskole). Acquired current title 2015
AdmissionRequirements: Audition in the respective major instrument/academic area, plus minors (ear training, piano, music theory)

Address.college_name: Danish School of Media and Journalism

GeneralInformation.History: N/A
Founded 1967 as Kunsthåndværkerskole (Arts and Crafts School). In 1998, the school changed its name to Kolding School of Design. Acquired present status 2010

Address.college_name: Fredericia School of Technology Management and Marine Engineering

GeneralInformation.History: N/A
Founded 1978
Founded 1991. Recognised as higher education institution since 2009
Founded 1999 as faculty hosted by the Copenhagen Business School. Acquired present status 2003
Created 1959

Address.college_name: MARTEC - Maritime and Polytechnic University College

GeneralInformation.History: Created in 1929. The college was stabled as the result of a merger of Frederikshavn Marine Engineer School and Frederikshavn Maritime Academy which were the oldest maritime schools in Denmark having established in 1929 and 1948 respectively.. In 2017, MARTEC merged with the Skagen Skipper School
Created 1966
Founded 1986

Address.college_name: Royal Danish Academy of Fine Arts, Schools of Architecture, Design and Conservation
Address.university_name: Det Kongelige Danske Kunstakademis Skoler for Arkitektur, Design og Konservering (KADK)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1973. Acquired present status following merger between the Royal Danish Academy of Fine Arts, School of Architecture and the Danish Design School
AdmissionRequirements: Upper secondary school leaving certificate (Studentereksamen), Higher preparatory examination (Højere Forberedelseseksamen, HF) or equivalent

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1867 as a private institution. Became a State institution under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Cultural Affairs 1949
Created 2001 following a merger of Kogtved Seafaring School, A.P. Møller Maersk Training school, Svendborg School of Marine Engineering, and Svendborg Navigation School

Founded 1829 as a State Institution under the supervision of the Ministry of Education. Departments restructured 1996. Acquired present status 2001. Merged with Copenhagen University College of Engineering (IHK) in 2013
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (studentereksamen) or foreign equivalent with defined levels of education in mathematics, physics and chemistry

Address.college_name: The Danish National School of Performing Arts

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Statens Scenekunstskole -The State Performing Arts School. (Also Known as Statens Teaterskole/National Theatre School of Denmark). Became part of The Danish National School of Performing Arts (DDSKS) after merger of Det Danske Musicalakademi i Fredericia (The Danish Musical Academy in Fredericia), Skuespilleruddannelsen ved Aarhus Teater (The Acting School at Aarhus Theatre); Skuespillerskolen i Odense (The Acting School in Odense); Dramatikeruddannelsen ved Aarhus Teater (School of Playwriting at Aarhus Theatre)Det Danske Musicalakademi i Fredericia (The Danish Musical Academy in Fredericia) 2015
Founded 1927. The Academy of Music, Aalborg, and The Royal Academy of Music, Aarhus merged in 2010

Address.college_name: The Royal Danish Academy of Fine Arts, School of Visual Arts
Address.university_name: Det Kongelige Danske Kunstakademi, Billedkunstskolerne – Kunstakademiets Billedkunstskoler

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1754 on the same lines as the Académie des Beaux Arts in France, and later acquired the status of a modern School of Art
Founded 2018 after the merger between Business Academy Lillebaelt and University College Lillebaelt
Created 2007 as University College Sjælland (University College Zealand). Acquired current title 2017

Address.university_name: Københavns Professionshøjskole – Copenhagen University of Applied Sciences (KP)

GeneralInformation.History: Professionshøjskolen UCC (UCC University College) and Professionshøjskolen Metropol (Metropolitan University College) have been merged and become Copenhagen's Professional College, 2018

Address.university_name: Professionshøjskolen University College Nordjylland – Professionshøjskolen UCN (UCN)

GeneralInformation.History: N/A
Founded 2011 following the merger of Professionshøjskolen University College Vest and Professionshøjskolen Syd University College
Founded in 1966 through a merger involving Odense University, the Southern Denmark School of Business and Engineering and South Jutland University Centre
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (studentereksamen) or Højere-Forberedelseseksamen or Handelseksamen, or recognized foreign equivalent

GeneralInformation.History: Founded from the merger of CVU Midt-Vest, CVU Vita, Jysk Center for Videregående Uddannelse, CVU Vitus Bering, CVU Alpha,TEKO, 2008
